question.title: jBPM Spring Boot + Spring Data
question.body:
Hello I'm created jBPM Spring Boot Embedded APP In general everything works fine But When I tried to add my custom entity and use JPARepository for it I meet the problem

I think potential problem that my enity connected to JBPMAutoConfiguration and JpaRepository can't register them but how to solve it I can't find solution

Below you can find my configs and stacktrace

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Not a managed type: class tv.ks.logicservice.entity.ProcessMetaData at org.hibernate.metamodel.internal.MetamodelImpl.managedType(MetamodelImpl.java:583) ~[hibernate-core-5.6.15.Final.jar:5.6.15.Final] at org.hibernate.metamodel.internal.MetamodelImpl.managedType(MetamodelImpl.java:85) ~[hibernate-core-5.6.15.Final.jar:5.6.15.Final] at org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.support.JpaMetamodelEntityInformation.<init>(JpaMetamodelEntityInformation.java:75) ~[spring-data-jpa-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.support.JpaEntityInformationSupport.getEntityInformation(JpaEntityInformationSupport.java:66) ~[spring-data-jpa-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.support.JpaRepositoryFactory.getEntityInformation(JpaRepositoryFactory.java:228) ~[spring-data-jpa-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.support.JpaRepositoryFactory.getTargetRepository(JpaRepositoryFactory.java:178) ~[spring-data-jpa-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.support.JpaRepositoryFactory.getTargetRepository(JpaRepositoryFactory.java:161) ~[spring-data-jpa-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.support.JpaRepositoryFactory.getTargetRepository(JpaRepositoryFactory.java:72) ~[spring-data-jpa-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.repository.core.support.RepositoryFactorySupport.getRepository(RepositoryFactorySupport.java:319) ~[spring-data-commons-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.repository.core.support.RepositoryFactoryBeanSupport.lambda$afterPropertiesSet$5(RepositoryFactoryBeanSupport.java:323) ~[spring-data-commons-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.util.Lazy.getNullable(Lazy.java:230) ~[spring-data-commons-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.util.Lazy.get(Lazy.java:114) ~[spring-data-commons-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.repository.core.support.RepositoryFactoryBeanSupport.afterPropertiesSet(RepositoryFactoryBeanSupport.java:329) ~[spring-data-commons-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.support.JpaRepositoryFactoryBean.afterPropertiesSet(JpaRepositoryFactoryBean.java:144) ~[spring-data-jpa-2.5.12.jar:2.5.12] at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.invokeInitMethods(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1863) ~[spring-beans-5.3.27.jar:5.3.27] at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.initializeBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1800) ~[spring-beans-5.3.27.jar:5.3.27] ... 16 common frames omitted

My Entity

@Entity
@Data
@Table(name = "process_metadata")
public class ProcessMetaData implements Serializable {

  @Id
  @GeneratedValue(
      strategy = GenerationType.AUTO
  )
  private Long id;

  @Enumerated(EnumType.STRING)
  private EventType eventType;

  private String userType;

}

And simple repo

 import org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository;
import org.springframework.stereotype.Repository;
import tv.ks.logicservice.entity.ProcessMetaData;

@Repository
public interface ProcessMetaDataRepository extends JpaRepository<ProcessMetaData, Long> {


}

If someone have a assumption how it can be fixed will be glad to hear them, Thanks!
